sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: Is Solid Power Inc Gaining or Losing Market Support?
feed.summary: Solid Power Inc.'s short interest as a percent of float has increased by 8.43% since its last report, now standing at 22.13 million shares sold short, or 11.7% of all regular shares. This rise in short interest suggests a more bearish market sentiment towards the stock. When compared to its peers, Solid Power Inc. has higher short interest, with the peer group average being 8.52%.

feed.title: How Insider Selling and New Severance Terms Will Impact Solid Power (SLDP) Investors
feed.summary: Solid Power recently disclosed that a director sold 30,000 shares and the company amended its executive severance plan, raising questions amidst ongoing losses and cash burn. These governance changes, paired with the company's financial strain despite high-profile partnerships, are influencing Solid Power's investment narrative. The company's future hinges on its solid electrolyte technology converting partnerships into commercial demand, with its deepened collaboration with Samsung SDI and BMW seen as a crucial catalyst.

feed.title: Solid Power (NASDAQ:SLDP) Stock Price Down 6.5% - Here's What Happened
feed.summary: Solid Power's stock (NASDAQ:SLDP) experienced a 6.5% drop during Wednesday trading, closing at $6.64 with significantly lower trading volume. Despite beating EPS and revenue estimates, the company remains unprofitable. Analyst opinions are mixed, with Needham raising its price target to $7 (Buy rating) and Weiss Ratings maintaining a Sell rating, leading to a consensus Hold rating with an average price target of $7.00.

feed.title: 313,302 Shares in Solid Power, Inc. $SLDP Acquired by Mitsubishi UFJ Asset Management Co. Ltd.
feed.summary: Mitsubishi UFJ Asset Management Co. Ltd. recently acquired 313,302 shares of Solid Power, Inc. (NASDAQ:SLDP) in the second quarter, valued at approximately $686,000, representing 0.17% of the company. Other institutional investors like Pure Financial Advisors and Goldman Sachs also adjusted their positions, bringing total institutional ownership to about 33.66%. Solid Power, trading around $6.05 with a $1.16 billion market cap, recently surpassed EPS and revenue estimates but remains unprofitable, facing a mixed analyst outlook with a consensus price target of $7.00.

feed.title: Solid Power Updates Executive Severance Plans
feed.summary: Solid Power, Inc. (SLDP) has amended its executive severance plan, separating it into a Severance Benefit Plan and a Change in Control Severance Plan for Executives, effective October 31 and November 19, 2025, respectively. These new plans outline specific severance benefits for the CEO and other executives in cases of involuntary termination or a change in control, thereby modifying the company's executive compensation structure. The stock currently holds a "Hold" rating from analysts with a $5.00 price target, while TipRanks' AI Analyst, Spark, rates SLDP as "Neutral" due to financial challenges and bearish momentum, despite some positive developments in partnerships.

feed.title: Will Solid Power’s (SLDP) Widening Losses Reveal Deeper Hurdles in Scaling Its Technology?
feed.summary: Solid Power, Inc. (SLDP) recently reported widening losses in Q3 2025, despite stable revenue, indicating challenges in commercializing its solid-state battery technology. While strategic partnerships like the one with Samsung SDI and BMW are positive for long-term potential, persistent operating losses remain a significant risk for the company. The fair value estimates for SLDP widely vary, suggesting a potential downside of 34% from its current price according to one analysis.

feed.title: Solid Power (NASDAQ: SLDP) plans results call/webcast at 4:30 p.m. ET Nov. 4
feed.summary: Solid Power, Inc. (NASDAQ: SLDP) announced it will release its third-quarter 2025 financial results on November 4, 2025, after market close. A conference call and live audio webcast will follow at 4:30 p.m. ET on the same day to discuss the results. The company is a leading developer of solid-state battery technology for the EV market.

feed.title: Solid Power (NASDAQ: SLDP) lowers cash investment outlook to $85–$95M range
feed.summary: Solid Power reported Q3 2025 financial results, including $4.6 million in revenue and operating expenses of $29.0 million. The company announced a Joint Evaluation Agreement with Samsung SDI and BMW and maintained a strong liquidity position of $300.4 million. Management also revised its 2025 cash investment outlook downwards to a range of $85 million to $95 million, reflecting a focus on innovation and optimized operating expenses.

feed.title: Solid Power Stock (SLDP) Opinions on Recent Price Surge and Partnerships | SLDP Stock News
feed.summary: Solid Power (SLDP) stock recently surged over 20%, driven by discussions on X about partnerships with BMW and Samsung SDI for solid-state battery development. Despite mixed financial reports showing $4.6 million in revenue and $279 million in liquidity, insider selling and significant institutional investor reductions contrast with a "Buy" rating from Needham.

feed.title: Solid Power Stock Soars 52% After Q3 Report And Battery Tech Update
feed.summary: Solid Power, Inc. (SLDP) saw its stock surge 52.31% following the release of its Q3 2025 financial results and strategic updates. The battery-technology firm reported strong gains in its solid-state electrolyte business and highlighted key partnerships. The company emphasized its licensing business model for its sulfide-based electrolyte, leading to increased investor interest and trading volume.

feed.title: Earnings Flash (SLDP) Solid Power, Inc. Reports Q3 Revenue $4.6M, vs. FactSet Est of $3.5M
feed.summary: Solid Power, Inc. (SLDP) announced Q3 revenue of $4.6 million, surpassing FactSet estimates of $3.5 million. The company is actively working on advancing its solid-state battery technology, collaborating with Samsung SDI and BMW on a validation project for all-solid-state batteries. Solid Power aims to commercialize its proprietary solid electrolyte material and cell designs.

feed.title: Solid Power Partners with Samsung SDI and BMW to Advance All-Solid-State Battery Technology
feed.summary: Solid Power has announced a strategic collaboration with Samsung SDI and BMW to develop and validate a demonstration vehicle powered by all-solid-state battery (ASSB) technology. This partnership leverages Solid Power's solid electrolyte technology, which Samsung SDI will integrate into cells for evaluation by BMW. The goal is to commercialize ASSB technology, offering improved energy density, battery life, and safety for electric vehicles.

feed.title: Solid Power (NASDAQ:SLDP) Trading 4.3% Higher - Here's What Happened
feed.summary: Solid Power (NASDAQ:SLDP) saw its stock price increase by 4.3% to $6.30, with a notable 31% surge in trading volume. This rise occurred despite the company missing earnings per share estimates in its latest report, though it did exceed revenue expectations. Analysts have mixed views, with Needham & Company upgrading their price target and giving a "buy" rating, while Weiss Ratings maintains a "sell."

feed.title: Solid Power (NASDAQ:SLDP) Shares Down 9.8% - Here's Why
feed.summary: Solid Power (NASDAQ:SLDP) shares dropped 9.8% on Thursday, with trading volume significantly above average. The company reported a Q3 loss of ($0.14) per share, missing estimates, although revenue exceeded expectations at $6.49 million. Analyst opinions are mixed, with Needham & Company LLC issuing a "buy" rating and Weiss Ratings maintaining a "sell" rating.

feed.title: MBL Wealth LLC Makes New $591,000 Investment in Solid Power, Inc. $SLDP
feed.summary: MBL Wealth LLC has invested $591,000 in Solid Power, Inc. (NASDAQ:SLDP), acquiring 270,000 shares, representing 0.15% ownership. Analyst opinions on Solid Power are mixed, with Needham & Company giving a "buy" rating with a $4.00 price target, while Weiss Ratings issued a "sell (d-)" rating. Solid Power recently reported a Q2 loss per share of ($0.14), missing estimates, but revenue exceeded expectations at $6.49 million.

feed.title: Solid Power’s Stock Slide: What Lies Ahead?​
feed.summary: Solid Power Inc. (NASDAQ: SLDP) experienced a significant stock decline of over 9% due to underwhelming quarterly results and hesitant investor sentiment. The company's recent financial overview reveals a net loss of over $25 million, sluggish revenue growth, and negative operating cash flow, despite having a low debt-to-equity ratio. Solid Power's future hinges on its ability to leverage new capital for R&D and strategic partnerships to improve operational efficiencies and transition towards profitability.

feed.title: Virtu Financial LLC Takes $96,000 Position in Solid Power, Inc. $SLDP
feed.summary: Virtu Financial LLC has acquired a new position in Solid Power, Inc. (NASDAQ:SLDP) totaling 91,358 shares valued at $96,000. This comes as Solid Power reported exceeding revenue expectations despite missing EPS estimates, and Needham & Company raised its price target on the stock. Other hedge funds, including Invesco Ltd. and Geode Capital Management LLC, have also adjusted their holdings in Solid Power.

feed.title: Solid Power (NASDAQ:SLDP) Stock Price Expected to Rise, Needham & Company LLC Analyst Says
feed.summary: Needham & Company LLC has increased its price target for Solid Power (NASDAQ:SLDP) from $2.00 to $4.00, reiterating a "buy" rating despite a potential short-term downside. The stock saw a significant gain of 26.1% recently, closing at $4.33, with high trading volume. Although the company reported a negative net margin and a slight miss on EPS estimates, its revenue surpassed expectations.

feed.title: Needham Doubles Solid Power (SLDP) Price Target, Cites EV Battery Progress
feed.summary: Needham has doubled its price target for Solid Power (SLDP) to $4, maintaining a Buy rating, due to the company's significant progress in solid-state EV battery technology. Solid Power has started shipping EV cells to automotive partners for testing, expanded its pilot production, and secured partnerships with major carmakers like BMW and Ford. This progress positions Solid Power as a key player in developing safer and more energy-dense alternatives to traditional lithium-ion batteries.

feed.title: BMW takes next steps in all-solid-state battery development
feed.summary: BMW is expanding its joint development agreement with Solid Power to further research and develop all-solid-state batteries (ASSBs) for its electric vehicles. This collaboration involves complementary cell development and manufacturing activities to advance ASSB design and manufacturing expertise. BMW anticipates receiving full-scale automotive ASSB cells for testing later this year, with a demonstrator vehicle planned before 2025.

feed.title: BMW Group and Solid Power deepen Joint Development Partnership
feed.summary: BMW Group and Solid Power have expanded their Joint Development Agreement to include a research and development license, allowing BMW to establish an all-solid-state battery (ASSB) prototype line at its Cell Manufacturing Competence Center. This partnership aims to accelerate the commercialization of ASSB technology, with Solid Power delivering full-scale automotive cells to BMW for testing in 2023 and a BMW demonstrator vehicle featuring ASSB technology planned before 2025. BMW also highlighted its Gen6 Li-Ion cell technology, expected to increase range significantly in its NEUE KLASSE models and contribute to a goal of over two million fully-electric vehicles on the road by the end of 2025.

feed.title: Solid Power (SLDP) Q2 results: $2.6M in revenue, EV-scale solid-state cell testing starts in Q3
feed.summary: Solid Power reported Q2 2022 revenue of $2.6 million, a significant increase from Q2 2021, and announced plans to begin testing EV-scale solid-state battery cells internally in Q3. The company also expects to deliver 20 Ah silicon anode cells to automotive partners Ford and BMW in Q3 and anticipates 2022 revenue to exceed previous guidance.

feed.title: Solid Power installs pilot production line for all-solid-state EV cells
feed.summary: Solid Power, a developer of solid-state battery cells, has completed the installation of a pilot production line for EV battery cells. These sulfide-based solid-state cells will feature anodes with over 50% active silicon and range from 60 to 100 Ah. The company plans to deliver these cells to BMW and Ford for automotive qualification testing by the end of 2022.

feed.title: Solid Power begins pilot production of solid-state batteries for Ford, BMW
feed.summary: Solid Power announced it has finished installing a pilot production line for solid-state batteries and aims to supply battery cells to partners Ford and BMW by the end of 2022. The company expects to produce 300 cells a week (15,000 cells a year) at full capacity, utilizing large-format, sulfide-based cells built with methods similar to lithium-ion batteries. This development is part of a broader industry trend with several OEMs investing in solid-state battery technology for its potential benefits including increased energy density, safety, and lower cost.

feed.title: Solid-State Batteries Are Here, and They're Going to Change How We Live
feed.summary: Solid-state lithium-metal batteries are poised to revolutionize energy storage, offering significantly increased power, faster charging times, and enhanced safety compared to traditional lithium-ion cells. Companies like Solid Power and researchers at institutions like Harvard are making breakthroughs that could lead to electric vehicles charging in minutes and batteries lasting decades. While commercial availability for mainstream applications is still a few years away, major partnerships and investments indicate a rapid progression toward these transformative technologies.
